description: The services for this project may include, but are not limited to: Janitorial cleaning services, housekeeping services, health clinics cleaning services, Window cleaning, deep cleaning, floor wax, and carpet cleaning, Removal of any accumulated snow or ice at building entries. Estimated cost is $3,483,300 over two years with the potential for a one-year extension. This is conditional on contract approval by the Department of National Defence (DND). The contract award requires a valid and active DESIGNATED ORGANIZATION SCREENING (DOS) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP) of Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

full_summary:
## Advance Procurement Notice for Janitorial Services at CFB Suffield, Alberta

### Project Overview

Defence Construction Canada - Western Region invites interested contractors to submit a sponsorship request application for potentially obtaining the required security clearance(s) for the Advance Procurement Notice of Janitorial Services at CFB Suffield, Alberta.

### Background Information

The current tender for Janitorial Services at CFB Suffield, Alberta is anticipated to be initiated in May 2024, conditional on the contract receiving approval to proceed by the Department of National Defence.

### Services and Estimated Costs

The services required for this project may include:

* Janitorial cleaning services (internal and external elements), housekeeping services, and health clinics cleaning services
* Window cleaning, deep cleaning, floor waxing, and carpet cleaning
* Removal of any accumulated snow or ice at building entries

The estimated cost for this project is approximately $3,483,300.00 over two years, with the potential for a one-year extension and an increase in value of up to $1,881,000.00.

### Security Requirements

Contractors will be required to actively hold the required security clearance(s) at the time of closing. The required security clearance(s) are anticipated to be a Valid and Active Designated Organization Screening (DOS) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

### Sponsorship Process

Defence Construction Canada is providing contractors with early access to the security clearance application process through its Industrial Security Program (ISP). Interested contractors are encouraged to begin the sponsorship request process by submitting an application to Defence Construction Canada.

### Application and Documents

Please submit a sponsorship request application to Defence Construction Canada by visiting their website: https://www.dcc-cdc.gc.ca/industry/security-requirements. The required information includes:

* Contract number 82329
* Level of clearance requested: DOS

### Notice and Contact Information

This Advance Procurement Notice can be accessed on the Merx website: https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2898308318/abstract?language=EN.

Contact Randy Archer, Contract Services Coordinator at Defence Construction Canada, at 403-544-4683 or randy.archer@dcc-cdc.gc.ca for further information or to submit any questions. Defence Construction Canada provides no assurances or guarantees that a sponsorship request package or security clearance application will be accepted or result in the granting of the requested security clearance(s) in a timely fashion.
